key_points: A South Carolina man, Andrew Hatley, is charged with federal crimes for participating in the Capitol riot on Jan. 6.
Hatley faces charges including entering a restricted building without authority and impeding government business.
Hatley was identified through witnesses, photographs, and a cellphone tracking app.
Federal authorities contacted Hatley on Jan. 12, and criminal charges were filed on Jan. 15.
The FBI used the 'Life360' location-tracking app to verify Hatley's presence at the Capitol.
A witness provided the FBI with photographs of Hatley inside the Capitol.
Hatley took a selfie in front of a statue of John C. Calhoun inside the Capitol building.
The FBI's Columbia field office had no substantial involvement in Hatley's investigation, according to spokesperson Agent Don Wood.
More than 200 people have been charged in connection to the Jan. 6 riot, which resulted in five deaths.
Hatley denied involvement in breaching the Capitol in a Facebook post that has since been taken down.
spokespersons: Agent Don Wood (Spokesperson, FBI's Columbia field office)
